Flint, MI, 48502-2036
Re: License #: CP250201139
Dear Ms. Lefear:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
4/17/2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at (517) 243 – 9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There was no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
2

Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan in response to the renewal
inspection completed on 3/14/24 with the corrective action plan approved on
3/29/24. The agency received a citation with FOM Policy 722-08D. There were
no violations during this reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator (CA)
identified some of the barriers the agency is face with such as caseload
responsibilities, placement limitation, parents of youth in care not participating and
parents consistently refusing parenting time. She reported timely uploading of
documents as well. The CA reported the department has made some
improvement with the use of checklists and trainings. However, continued
improvement is needed in the areas of documents being signed and uploaded,
timely entry of data into MiSACWIS, and adherence to policy standard for program
areas. CA reported there have been progress made, but the emergent nature of
some placements, stress and requirements of the foster care position, and the
inexperienced nature of some staff remain barriers.
Financial Overview:
Not applicable.
Staff Interviews:
The staff interviewed feel highly supported by upper management and stated their
director is awesome. Their supervisors, management team and coworkers are
always there to assist if the need arises. Staff feel that management staff have an
open-door policy and they feel welcome to discuss any type of issue with them if
the need arises. They reported having unit meetings to discuss issues, and that
the training opportunity for staff is great. Staff reported the key to getting
cooperation between management and staff is open communication and
teamwork among departments.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment to perform required job duties.
Files are stored securely and in a manner that provides unauthorized access.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS:
There was one safety alert:
Safety Alert: Unlicensed relative had multiple electrical outlets throughout the home
that were uncovered and a ventilation area in the youth’s bedroom that was
uncovered.
Resolution: Due to this being an unlicensed relative home, a special evaluation was
not opened on the home. The Foster Care Specialist and Supervisor assisted the
unlicensed relative by purchasing, delivering and installing socket outlets and vents
remained intact throughout the home. Unlicensed relative and biological mother were
present during the home visit on 3/6/25. They were educated on the importance of
ensuring outlets and vents remained intact throughout the home and was receptive
of the information provided. Prior to Foster care Worker and Supervisor leaving the
home, installations of all needed covers were intact and verified. Photos are attached
to the safety alert.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
4/21/2025
_____________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
